doc:
Baby LeRoy https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baby_LeRoy 0 Baby LeRoy (May 12, 1932 – July 28, 2001) was a child actor who appeared in films in the 1930s. When he was sixteen months old, he became the youngest person ever put under term contract by a major studio.Born Ronald Le Roy Overacker in Los Angeles, California, Baby LeRoy's career began when he was less than a year old, co-starring with Maurice Chevalier in A Bedtime Story, and ended with a cameo role as himself in Cinema Circus (1937). He is best known for his appearances in three W. C. Fields films: Tillie and Gus (1933), The Old Fashioned Way (1934) and It's a Gift (1934). Baby_LeRoy ( May_12_,_1932 – July_28_,_2001 ) was a_child_actor who appeared in films in the_1930s . When he was sixteen_months old , he became the_youngest_person ever_put under term_contract by a_major_studio.Born_Ronald_Le_Roy_Overacker in Los_Angeles , California , Baby_LeRoy 's_career began when he was less than a_year_old , co-starring with Maurice_Chevalier in A_Bedtime_Story , and ended with a_cameo_role as himself in Cinema_Circus_(_1937_) . He is_best_known for his_appearances in three_W._C._Fields_films : Tillie_and_Gus_(_1933_) , The_Old_Fashioned_Way_(_1934_) and It 's a_Gift_(_1934_) .
